column23: Officers responded to a call from victim's friends telling them he was in crisis and has "a history of mental illness and was cutting himself". He was evaluated and determined not qualify to be committed. A subsequent call to 911 was made a short time later and when officers arrived and engaged with him he was allegedly holding a knife. The police say that he advanced on them with a knife, they deployed tasers and then fired their guns, killing him.

column17: W Broward Boulevard and NW 27th Avenue
column23: The police claim they were engaged in an undercover narcotics sting when the victim recognized police and fled in his car. Officers pursued, and the driver crashed into multiple vehicles before exiting the car to flee on foot. While in pursuit, police claim he turned toward officers while holding a handgun and then they killed him. At least one witness indicates victim had his hands above his head, complying with officers' instructions when he was shot.

The police claim they were responding to reports of a man staggering thru the neighborhood with a gun, and of shots fired. The police encountered the victim and claim that he pointed the weapon at officers. The police then killed him.

Police report that officers were responding to a call about a stolen car, which they then linked to the victim and a number of related, outstanding arrest warrants. Upon following up at a nearby residence, police allege they saw the victim try and leave out a window before firing shots at officers while advancing toward them. Police fired their weapons in response, striking and killing the victim.

column17: Starboard Restaurant, located at 2009 Coastal Highway
column23: There were reports that Robinson had a gun leaving a restaurant. They searched for him but could not find him. He allegedly returned to the restaurant. The police arrived and chased him. The police shot him while he was fleeing and he died.

column17: near Heyward Brockington Road, between Monticello and Fairfield roads
column23: The police said that they were responding to a domestic violence incident involving a weapon that was later determined to be a wooden stick. The police allege that he charged at the police after being tased after which they apparently shot him 10 times, killing him.  The police dispute that he was shot 10 times.

Two officers from the Bonne Terre Police Department were dispatched to the Motel 6 in Bonne Terre for a reported disturbance. When the officers arrived, a man exited the motel room and allegedly began exchanging shots with them. Victim was killed during the exchange.

The police allege that they attempted to initiate a traffic stop for a drug investigation. While fleeing in the vehicle the victim allegedly struck three undercover sheriff's vehicles while fleeing, after which they fired on him while in the car. Also in the vehicle were three children and a female passenger.
Non-fatal shooting of a man in a mental-health crisis allegedly with a knife

column17: W Laurel and N Hamilton Ave
column23: Officers on patrol recognized the victim as someone wanted on one or more felonies. After seeing officers, the man allegedly fled on foot. Three officers opened fire when the victim allegedly pulled a gun from his waistband.

Someone made a threatening 911 call saying they wanted to "stab everyone". Officer Toral arrived and the victim approached his vehicle and allegedly stabbed Toral multiple times with scissors. Officer Dunn then arrived and shot and killed the victim.

While off-duty working security at a nearby fuel two the officer allegedly encountered the suspect exchanging gunfire with another person. When the victim allegedly would not comply with verbal commands, the officer shot and killed him.
The police allege that victim arrived at a detention center and fired aa firearm when three officers responded with gunfire, killing the victim.

Responding to a call of people in a white vehicle banging on the door of a residence, officers allege a white sedan matching description was speeding away. During subsequent pursuit the vehicle collided with another, stopping. As officers approached, they allege seeing a weapon near the driver when two deputies fired their weapons, killing the man.

During a traffic stop, police had asked the driver to exit the vehicle and were conducting a pat-down when a physical struggle ensued. During the struggle, another officer fired a single shot resulting in the death of the victim.

An officer with a municipal department attempted a traffic stop and the driver would not stop. County sheriff's took up the pursuit and the car was ultimately disabled. With the car stopped, police approached the vehicle and allegedly heard a single gunshot. Police fired their weapons at the driver in response.

Police from multiple agencies engaged in a lengthy standoff after being called to a residence about a threatening person with a gun. Victim would not come out until hours later, when he came out on porch and allegedly pointed a gun at officers, when officers opened fire and killed him.
A stolen car was spotted by officers. Deputies closed in on the parked vehicle and victim allegedly backed the car up toward officers when an officer fired the shot that killed him.

Police were looking for victim to detain them as part of a homicide investigation when they encountered him walking on the street. Officers running to catch up with victim allege they were fired upon and one officer exchanged fire, killing him

Responding to a disturbance call, officers approached victim and asked to perform a pat-search. When officers put a hand on Wilson, they allege that he pulled a gun and shot at the officer, striking him in the right thigh. The officer returned fire, after which the victim fled on foot. Wilson was found a short time later and taken to the hospital where he later died of his wounds.

Officers were responding to a robbery call at a business when they located the victim, running from the area. After a chase, they located them in an apartment and had him exit, when he fled on foot again. Police caught him and allege he fired a shot from a weapon, when multiple officers returned fire, killing him

Officers from Sparks Police, Reno Police and Washoe County Sheriff's Office encountered victim while trying to serve a warrant when victim allegedly ran. K9 was used and victim allegedly brandished a gun when officers opened fire. A gun was later found some distance from victim
Police allege they spotted victim and, recognizing him as a suspect in another crime, began a foot chase where they shot victim

An off-dudy HPD officer working as mall security engaged victim after his credit card was declined in a store. There was an altercation where the victim allegedly pulled the officer's handgun and shot him. After police responded they identified the victim in the mall carrying an ice pick, and after refusing to put it down was shot by two officers.

Police were following up on a dropped 911 call. When arriving on location with 8 officers, they handcuff and question two men who were leaving the residence. They verbally contact the victim, still in the house, who then called 911 and explained he had a gun and was inside with one other man. In contact with police, he came to the exit with his hands and weapon visible and police fired their weapons and hit victim. Records indicate victim then went back inside and shot the other occupant, then died of his injuries.

Police allege that victim collided with an officers vehicle and fled. After later finding the vehicle, victim allegedly backed her car into another officer, who opened fire, emptying two clips of bullets which killed her

Responding to a call about a dangerous man, police arrived at a wedding to investigate. After engaging the victim, police allege he assaulted an officer and in response they deployed taser and then fired a weapon. Family disputes assault claim. Victim died at the scene.

Police day that city license plate readers alerted officers to a vehicle of interest in connection to a robbery. The officers followed the vehicle watched the driver park and get out of the vehicle. Officers then approached the car when the driver got back into the vehicle. With officers on foot outside of the car they allege the driver accelerated and hit an officer, when police then opened fire. The injured victim got out was handcuffed and died on the street outside of the car.

The police claim that they were executing an order to evict Lewis and many agencies joined. Later that morning they executed a search warrant for a gun. They claim that later they attempted to arrest Lewis for unlawful firearm possession and he approached them aggressively with a knife and an officer fired his gun in response.

City police and US Marshalls were executing an arrest warrant at victim's residence when he allegedly opened the door armed with gun. After a brief and unsuccessful attempt to negotiate surrender, officers shot and killed the man.

Patrolling officer allege they encountered victim walking on the street and could smell marijuana from their vehicle and ordered him to stop. Officers allege that victim refused to stop and was physically brought to the ground. A shot was fired while officer was on top of victim, after which officer pulled off and fired his weapon.

There was a warrant for the victim's arrest — about an hour before officers fatally shot Charion Lockett, a criminal justice graduate studying for law school. Authorities said the shooting happened when Charion Lockett allegedly opened fire on police from a parked car in the family home driveway and that firearms were recovered. The family and attorney are refuting the account of the story and are requesting a release of the body cam footage.

The Georgetown County Sheriff’s Office said the chase was initiated by an officer with the Hemingway Police Department in Williamsburg County that led into Georgetown County, ending in a crash.  The video shows the officer did not have a valid reason to initiate a traffic stop.
Amir Locke was fatally shot by Minneapolis police officers in an apartment early Wednesday morning as officers were executing a "no-knock" search warrant.

column17: West Florissant Avenue and Lang Drive
column23: The police engage in a high-speed car chase with a car they say is linked to a homicide. The passengers exit the car, run, and out of the sight of the body cameras, the police kill Mr. Hopson as they say that he shot at them first.
Off-duty deputy allegedly saw a man on his ring breaking into his house. He saw the victim nearby and followed him into the woods where he then proceeded to have an "altercation" and shot the victim.

Police found victim sleeping in car. The police reported that when trying to get the victim's attention and spotted a handgun in the front seat, the victim reversed into a police vehicle and officers fired and killed the victim.

NYPD officers responding to a 911 call reportedly were fired upon by the victim when entering. One officer was killed and another is in critical condition. McNeil exhcanged fire with a third officer who shot McNeil. McNeil became brain dead and died later at the hospital.

column17: 17700 block of West Lake Houston Parkway
column23: Victim was suspect to a homicide. Sheriff's came across victim and he started to run. The deputies reported that while he was running it seemed he was armed and pointing a weapon towards them. Deputies shot victim, victim was pronounced dead at the hospital

Police were responding to a vehicle break-in. The police came across the victim who they suspected to "fit the profile." The victim fled. The officers reported that the victim was armed and shot the victim. Victim was pronounced dead at the hospital.

A man was in police custody and receiving treatment for unknown reasons at Duke University Hospital. At some point, police allege the individual got into a scuffle with a Durham Police officer and got the officer's gun. A Duke University Police Department officer responded to the scene. The Duke officer shot and killed the individual.
column24: "Duke University Police Department, Durham Police Department"

column23: Deputy Jeffrey Hash claims Walker jumped on his vehicle and broke his windshield. Hash shot and killed Walker. Hash was off-duty at the time.

Police went to an apartment complex looking for an alleged kidnapping suspect. Never announcing themselves, a group of police with weapons out knocked aggressively on a residence's door multiple times. Afraid, the family gathered the children in the rear of the home and a female inside phoned 9110 about aggressive knocks when the door was opened. Police reportedly encountered the victim as he opened the door after multiple knock attempts and claim the victim brandished a firearm. A deputy shot and killed Willis.
Deputies responded to a domestic violence call. Deputies claim they witnessed a man shoot and pistol whip his father before allegedly opening fire on the officers. Deputies shot and killed Smith.

Williams was firing an AR15 rifle toward the sky in celebration of the new year. Police arrived at the residence and fired at Williams through a privacy fence. Video from the incident confirms the police did not announce their presence or provide any warning. Police shot and killed Williams.

Police were looking for someone who had shot someone. Officers conducted a traffic stop of the person they thought was involved at the intersection of Wayne Avenue and Dartmouth Avenue. That's when the driver of the vehicle fired rounds at the officers, according to police. Montgomery County Police officers returned fire, striking the driver. Police say that the suspect died on the scene.
Police engaged McKnight for an unknown reason when an officer shot and killed McKnight. Police are withholding all other details at this time.
On December 28, officers fatally shot Dwayne McDonald, the 62-year-old wanted in connection with the deaths of his wife and stepdaughter who were killed on Christmas day, during a raid.

According to Titusville police spokesperson Amy Matthews in a release on Sunday, the officer-involved shooting happened in the 1500 block of Gayle Avenue after officers responded to the area shortly after 7 p.m. in response to a 911 call that reported a woman was being violently assaulted by a man in the roadway. �The first officer on the scene spotted a suspect,� said Matthews. �The suspect initially fled on foot, but then engaged in a physical altercation with the officer. The officer discharged his firearm and the suspect was struck.�
As horrified shoppers looked on, police and a man exchanged gunshots at a Walmart in DeKalb County on Friday, leading to the alleged shoplifter�s death on a busy Christmas Eve.

Police responded to reports of Fiafonou walking around with a machete. Officers confronted him, but he reportedly ran to a nearby apartment building. Officers spent over a day attempting to get Fiafonou out of the building. Fiafonou reportedly left the apartment eventually and went to a nearby gas station. Police allege Fiafonou was carrying a knife. Officer Zachary Gast shot and killed Fiafonou.

According to Assistant Chief Michael Kemper, commanding officer of Patrol Borough Brooklyn South, police wound up opening fire on the now-deceased suspect after making numerous attempts to stop him through non-lethal force � including deploying Tasers, which had no effect on the man. Police said the trouble began at about 4:10 a.m. on Dec. 20, when uniformed officers from the 71st Precinct responded to reports of a man armed with a knife and a gun in the area of 1090 Eastern Pkwy. in Crown Heights. Upon arriving at the scene, Kemper said, the officers spotted the male suspect, not identified, carrying a knife in one hand, with his other hand concealed in a coat pocket. A knife was found on him but no gun was found.
On December 19, Detroit police shot and killed Nakita Williams at a gas station on 7 Mile and Hayes. They say she was pointing an airsoft gun at customers and officers.

Eric L. Nelson was involved in a single-vehicle crash about noon and deputies responded. Deputies learned that there were felony warrants previously issued against Nelson in Bogalusa and they asked the Bogalusa Police to come. When the Bogalusa officers arrived, Nelson ran away and after a brief chase on foot, during which a Taser was used, he was arrested. Nelson began complaining of respiratory issues and died.

A chase began in West Memphis, Arkansas, and ended in Memphis, Tennessee, when a trooper spotted a car matching one on an outstanding warrant out of South Carolina. Trooper Spencer Morris exchanged gunfire with the men, and at least one of them shot and injured him during the chase. Terrance Dogan, 27, and John H. Taylor, 18, were killed by the trooper.

A chase began in West Memphis, Arkansas, and ended in Memphis, Tennessee, when a trooper spotted a car matching one on an outstanding warrant out of South Carolina. Trooper Spencer Morris exchanged gunfire with the men, and at least one of them shot and injured him during the chase. Terrance Dogan, 27, and John H. Taylor, 18, were killed by the trooper.

Jahad Patterson allegedly was attempting to break into a liquor store when police responded. Police engaged Patterson in the parking lot of a nearby strip mall, where they shot and killed him. Police say Patterson had a gun in his possession.

At about 11:30 a.m., deputies responded to a report of a shooting at a Nation's Giant Hamburgers, where an armed man entered and robbed the cashier. An off-duty officer from the UC Berkeley Police Department was dining at the restaurant and confronted Amanuel Moreno. The officer fired one shot, killing Moreno.

Police responded to a report of a suspicious vehicle. An officer approahced the vehicle, and asked the driver to get out of the car. The individual got out of the car and began speaking to the officer. The officer alleges the conversation escalated to an altercation. The officer shot and killed the individual.

Victim died after attending a film with a friend. In getting concessions, employees indicated victim attacked them and an off-duty deputy working who works as security for the theater returned to the theater and got into an altercation with victim. the deputy then fought. After being arrested an ambulance was called and victim went into what police called “medical distress.” He lost consciousness and died despite CPR being administered. Family members upon viewing body-cam video said that the victim told the off-duty deputy and workers at the theater that he could not breathe.

Police responded to reports of someone violating a protective order. The caller reported Sanders was waving a gun inside the home. Police got Sanders to exit the home, and claim there was a confrontation. Police shot and killed Sanders.

Police were looking for a suspect in relation to a rape and robbery case. Upon arrival, police found Joker in an SUV outside of a convenience store, along with an infant in the vehicle. Police state Joker refused to exit the vehicle or release the infant to police. Police say Joker later released the infant from the SUV, but Joker remained inside. Police allege Joker eventually exited the vehicle and fired shots, striking two officers. Police returned fire, killing Joker.
column24: "West Valley City Police Department, Salt Lake County Unified Police Department"

column23: Gatling reportedly shot two investigators with the DeKalb County Sheriff's Office. Police later found Gatling hiding in the woods after a caller reported a "suspicious person" in the area. Police shot and killed Gatling.
column24: "DeKalb County Police Department, Atlanta Police Department"

column23: Deputies responded to a domestic call in the town of Yellow Bluff at around 5 p.m. Deputies were responding to the call when a woman ran out of a home. He said a man followed her, firing shots and that one of the deputies was struck in the neck. Police were unsure if Billy Bizzell's death was self-inflicted or if he had been shot by either of the deputies.
Anthony Oliver allegedly shot three people at Kalamazoo bus station. Kalamazoo police arrived about two minutes after the first 911 call. Officers shot and killed Oliver.

Officers were called about 2:35 p.m., after the suspect allegedly shot Gevork Minissian, 70. Devin Edward Hall allegedly tried to flee from police by jumping into a woman's car and attempting to carjack her. However, the man was unable to steal the car and exchanged gunfire with police before running onto Sunnyslope Avenue. Hall allegedly attempted to carjack a second woman, but again failed to steal the vehicle and held the woman at gunpoint until he was cornered by police. The man exchanged fire with police and was shot and killed.

Womack was a former detective for the Kansas City Police Department. Police responded to reports of a man standing in the middle of a road and jumping into traffic. Upon arrival, police claim Womack started running towards them. Womack was reportedly able to get into the driver's seat of a patrol car. Police attempted to remove Womack from the car and police claim they fought over the officer's gun. Womack was allegedly able to get the gun away from the officer, and allegedly pointed it towards another officer. Police shot and killed Womack.

Bowden was wanted in relation to an armed robbery that had happened earlier in the day. Police saw his vehicle and a pursuit began. Bowden reportedly crashed his car and shots were fired, and Bowden drove away. Bowden then reportedly went to a small store and held a number of people hostage inside once police arrived. Police eventually entered the store and shot and killed Bowden.

Police had been on a four-day manhunt for Vicosa and Tia Bynum, who were accused of kidnapping Vicosa’s two daughters,. Vicosa was a former Baltimore County Police officer and Bynum was an active BCP officer. After a brief police pursuit into Western Maryland ended with a car crash, police found Vicosa, Bynum and the two girls inside the car with gunshot wounds, reported as a murder-suicide. Three died at the scene and one girl was flown to a hospital where she later died.

Officers responded to a call of a burglary in progress, and when they arrived, they encountered Sylvester Tart, who reportedly barricaded himself in a closet. When Tart was told to come out, he began firing through the door. Officers shot and killed Tart.
Mann was outside an ER entrance and reportedly being combative with hospital security. An officer who was already in the ER responded to assist. The officer shot and killed Mann.
Police responded to reports of a shooting at a local lounge. Police shot and killed a man.

Hollywood police officers were chasing Christopher Walls, who was suspected of carjacking someone and then fleeing with the victim's vehicle � a black 2018 Alfa Romeo. Police pursued until he crashed the car around 9:35 p.m. Witnesses of the arrest, allege police brutalized the boy. Walls was handed over into the custody of Miami-Dade police, and he became unconscious and died.
Michael A. Quarrles was shot and killed after allegedly fighting with several police officers responding to a domestic violence call.

A security guard at a Walmart requested police after claiming a man pointed a firearm at him and threatening to shoot responding police officers. Police found Raney in the parking lot and claim Raney pointed a firearm at them. Police shot and killed Raney.

Barry Rigsby was suspected of killing three people. He was shot and killed hours later by state police after holing up at an apartment and firing at sheriff's deputies. He was being sought in connection with the deaths of his wife, Adriana Perry Rigsby, 29; her son, Xavier Perry, 12; and her brother, Joshua Perry, 18.

Corey Stanley was wanted in a home invasion and assault. He was accused of breaking into a couple's home and beating them with a rock. They found him outside a white sedan parked in a parking lot. Stanley got back into the driver's seat as officers approach. He allegedly drove toward officers, and they shot and killed him.

Officers responding to an apartment home about 1 p.m. Leon Perry had called 911 and was incoherent before putting on the phone a child who told dispatchers they needed help. Officers arrived at the complex, Seminole Hills, and Perry began yelling that people were going to get him. A 7-year-old boy who was bound by his wrists and neck came to police from the apartment. Officers untied him, and he said there had been an argument and that his mother had been assaulted. Officers heard a gunshot and entered the apartment. When they got inside, Perry pushed Blades' lifeless, bound body down the stairs. During a confrontation, officers shot and killed Perry and rescued a 4-year-old girl, also bound.

Gunfire was first reported at the Atlantic House Midtown apartments about 3:25 a.m. Officers responded within five minutes. Jarvis Jarrette allegedly fired a rifle at responding officers, and at least one officer shot and killed him. Jarrette had allegedly killed a woman he was dating, Courtney Cox, 31.

Police responded to reports of an armed individual potentially doing drugs. Upon arrival, police determined they had "probably cause" to arrest Robb on a charge of grand theft auto. Police shot and killed Robb.

Deputies responded to reports of a woman being chased by a man with a knife at a residence. Upon arrival, deputies claim Harris lunged at them with a knife. One deputy was reportedly stabbed twice. Harris was shot and killed by deputies.

Jim Rogers was killed when he was shocked by a Taser multiple times by Pittsburgh Police in the city's Bloomfield neighborhood. Police said the tasering happened when Rogers was non-compliant during his arrest over an alleged attempted theft of a bicycle.

Police responded to reports of an armed robbery at a 7-11. A bit later, police were called to a hit-and-run crash that they claim was connected to the robbery. Lieutenant Meade shot and killed Singleton. The surrounding details are unclear at this time.

Jermaine Jones and his father and his uncle were pulled over for a tinted case covering the license plate. Officers asked the driver, Jones' uncle, for consent to search the vehicle. Another deputy then arrived with a dog that reportedly smelled narcotics in the vehicle.An officer found a handgun and crack pipe under the rear passenger seat where Jones was sitting and Jones fled. An officer tasered him, from which he died a week later.

Officers were conducting an investigation when they reportedly heard gunshots. After arriving on the scene, officers reportedly observed a group of men firing weapons at another group of people. One officer fired his gun, and it is unclear if anyone was hit by the shot. The group of men then began running on foot, and officers pursued them. At some point, Officer Glenn Vargas shot and killed Carothers, although it is unclear at which point in the events.
Deputies responded to a domestic dispute. Deputies claim Robinson showed a weapon. Deputies shot and killed Robinson.

Officer responded to a report for a man who was acting strange and causing damage while standing on a vehicle. Police attempted to arrest Jackson for a probation hold, but he allegedly resisted and was combative. Police tasered him. According to police, officers spoke with Jackson for 45 minutes before being able to identify him and learning he was on probation. They said when they tried to arrest him, he fled, and he allegedly began moving toward an officer, he was tasered at least three times.
column24: "Altoona Police Department, Eau Claire County Sheriff's Office"

column23: Ramone Dwight allegedly sped away from a license checkpoint on Highways 129 and 169, while shooting at police. Dwight then led police on a high-speed chase that reached speeds of more 100 miles per hour. He lost control of his car and got out and shot at officers. An Evans County deputy and a Hagan police officer shot and killed him.
column24: "Evans County Sheriff's Office, Hagan Police Department"

column23: Police claim Murphy shot at corrections officers outside of the Hardeman County Criminal Justice Complex. Murphy reportedly drove away from the jail, and later returned. Police claim Murphy confronted them with a gun, and police shot and killed Murphy.

An officer with the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives was attempting to bring a man into custody in connection with a drug investigation when gunfire was exchanged. The officer shot and killed Corey Daniel Wellman, the man who was sought.
column24: U.S. Bureau of Alcohol Tobacco Firearms and Explosives

column23: A deputy responded to a gas station for an unknown emergency. The deputy shot and killed a person there. There are no other details about the incident available at this time.
A DEA task force was apparently searching a train. An agent was shot and killed by Damon Taylor, who was also shot and killed.
column24: "U.S. Drug Enforcement Administration, Tucson Police Department"

column23: Calcasieu Parish Sheriff's Office received an anonymous tip regarding the whereabouts of an escaped inmate, Desmond Louis. Louis had an arrest warrant through the Beauregard Parish Sheriff's Office for simple escape after he fled from a work detail on September 20, 2021. Upon learning of Louis' location, the CPSO and LCPD arrived at a home in Lake Charles and began calling Louis and the other occupants out of the house. Louis allegedly fired shots at officers from inside the residence. A short time later, Louis exited the house through the front door and fired additional shots at officers, who shot and killed him.
column24: "Calcasieu Parish Sheriff's Office, Lake Charles Police Department"

column23: Cole was reportedly wanted for a domestic violence warrant. Deputies saw Cole driving and claim Cole pulled off the road and began running. A deputy ran after Cole and alleges Cole jumped up at them and "reached for his waistband." The deputy shot and killed Cole.
Police were serving a narcots arrest warrant at Ledet's apartment complex, when they claim Ledet shot at officers. The officers returned fire, killing Ledet.

John Shortt allegedly led a four-person crew as they attempted to rob an unidentified officer and a female companion after the pair had left a nightclub. Shortt and an accomplice, who was wearing a balaclava, initially approached the officer and the woman at about 3:20 a.m. and allegedly pointed a handgun at him. The officer drew his own gun and began firing at the would-be robbers. The officer shot Shortt at least once. Two alleged accomplices of Shortt, Tyshawn Whidbee and Joshua Cooper, approached the officer and the woman from another direction. Whidbee pulled a gun and began firing at the cop and woman, shooting both of them. The officer was hit a number of times, and he shot and killed Cooper. John Shortt was charged with assaulting an officer with a deadly weapon.

Cameron was wanted for a state parole violation and for questioning in a homicide case. Cameron reportedly exited a hotel room armed with an AR-15 and police allege Cameron fired shots at them. Police returned fire, killing Cameron.
Police shot and killed Robert Parks while he barricaded himself and a hostage in an apartment. He reportedly was armed.

Police responded to trespassing/loitering call. Upon arrival, Lewis reportedly ran away from police. An officer caught up to Lewis, and police claim they engaged in a "lengthy physical altercation." Police allege Lewis pulled out a gun during the altercation. The officer shot and killed Lewis.

Vereen allegedly pulled away from a traffic stop for speeding and crashed into a building. Vereen reportedly attempted to run away and police caught up to him. A state trooper attempted to place Vereen under arrest, and claims a struggle ensued. The trooper shot and killed Vereen.

Troopers pulled over Charlie Moore for speeding. They said that he did not produce his driver's license. Moore allegedly drove off and began speeding again while driving recklessly, for three and a half miles along Highway 92, until troopers knocked the vehicle off the road using a police vehicle. Moore's car spun off the highway and flipped upside down. Passenger Leden Boykins was killed.

Williams was reportedly picking up food at the front desk of an apartment building when a staff member identified him as someone who was supposedly banned from the property. Officer John Diggs lived at the complex and performed private security duties escorted Williams outside. An altercation occurred, in which Williams pulled out toy weapons. Diggs deployed his taser twice, but reportedly did not hiw Williams. Diggs shot Williams multiple times, killing him.
A deputy pulled over Paris Wilder on West New Haven Avenue for unspecified reasons, and Wilder reportedly shot the deputy. Two deputies shot and killed Wilder.
Police claim Moore set fire to a police vehicle and assaulted an officer in the agency's parking lot. Three officers shot at Moore, killing him.

Around 2:45 p.m., officers from the California Highway Patrol and Del Norte County Sheriff's Office responded to a disabled vehicle, which was blocking the road. Upon arrival, the officers discovered a man was walking in the road with a knife. Robert Anderson allegedly advanced toward the officers, and an officer shot and killed him.
column24: "California Highway Patrol, Del Norte County Sheriff's Office"

column23: A murder suspect from California, Jamar Jason Taylor, saw uniformed officers waiting for him on the platform at Union Station around 5 p.m. and took off running, police said. He allegedly shot at the Amtrak officers, who shot and killed him.
Police initiated a traffic stop with Lamb for an undisclosed reason. Police allege Lamb fled the traffic stop, crashed into two cars, and exchanged gunfire with officers. Police shot and killed Lamb.

James Matalice Smith barricaded himself inside a home after shooting Deputy John Pollock. Pollock was shot while trying to serve a warrant at that home. Around 3 a.m., Smith was coming out of his home, with police believing he was surrendering. As officers attempted to take him into custody Smith fired a gun at the trooper, hitting him in the arm. Police shot and killed Smith.
column24: "Burleson County Sheriff's Office, Texas Department of Public Safety"

column23: Police initiated a traffic stop for erratic driving. Brown reportedly did not cooperate and sped away. Police eventually boxed Brown's car in, and Brown allegedly attempted to get away by hitting multiple police vehicles. Police then drew their weapons and at least one officer fired 12 rounds at Brown, killing him.

Police responded to a call and an individual pointed out Bey stating that he was the reason the individual had called the police. An officer began to approach Bey, and claims that Bey turned towards the officer with a hand near his waistband. The officer demanded to see Bey's hands, and Bey allegedly ran away. Later, police heard a gunshot and saw someone who had been shot. Police observed Bey driving away from the scene. A vehicular pursuit began, which police eventually ended with stop sticks. Police allegedly observed Bey pointing a gun at them. The pursuit continued again on foot, before police shot and killed Bey.

Police responded to an apartment complex for an unreported reason. Jackson allegedly attempted to run over an officer, and a deputy shot and killed Jackson. There are no other details around the shooting available.
Shelton was reportedly pointing a gun at people. Bicycle officers responded to the scene and reportedly told Shelton to drop the weapon. Three officers shot and killed Shelton.

A shooting occurred in the parking lot of The District in Lafayette. An officer with the Lafayette Police Department, assigned to a security detail, approached one of the groups of people believed to be involved in the incident. As the officer approached, one or more persons allegedly fired upon him, and the officer shot back, killing Dashawn Batiste.
King was an employee at a warehouse. As shifts were changing, King reportedly fired at employees, including security guards and a manager. Responding police shot and killed King.
Lucas was wanted on multiple arrest warrants. Police attempted to take Lucas into custody, and claim he repeatedly pointed a handgun at officers. Police shot and killed Lucas.

Police responded to reports of a woman with a gun in a drive-thru. Wilson reportedly never had a gun, and the restaurant misled police. Upon arrival, police ordered Wilson to exit her vehicle and she reportedly refused. Police attempted to force Wilson out of the vehicle, striking her several times. Wilson's foot hit the gas of the vehicle, and police shot and killed her.

Parker was attending a block party event. An officer was patrolling the area and allegedly encountered gunfire. The officer fired his weapon, shooting Parker, a bystander. Neighbors at the party state Parker was attempting to help de-escalate a fight when he was shot.

column23: Following a chaotic crime spree with multiple locations, Leslie Scarlett allegedly rammed into an officer's car. The officer started to get out, and Scarlett opened fire on the officer. Officer Danny Leon shot and killed him.
Peterson reportedly shot and killed two people in a motel and wounded two others after allegedly opening fire on police who responded to the scene. Police shot and killed Peterson.

Police pulled over a vehicle in which Mincey was a passenger for a traffic violation. Police claim that Mincey pointed a gun at police during the traffic stop. Officer Thomas Love shot and killed Mincey as he was reportedly exiting the vehicle.

Bogard was a suspect in a previous shooting at a Walmart. Police found Bogard at a motel and Bogard reportedly barricaded himself in a room. Bogard reportedly fired at police, and police shot and killed him.

LeRoux spoke with someone from the police department's emergency command center as well as a sergeant. At some point, LeRoux sat up from a reclining position and police immediately fired at LeRoux, killing him. LeRoux's mother stated LeRoux had been depressed and was living out of his vehicle.

Police had reportedly determined White was wanted on two warrants after running his plates. White reportedly wouldn't exit his vehicle and police claim he pulled out a gun. 4 officers shot White, killing him.

Officers responded to a call at a home. Police shot and killed a man at the home. There are no other details available at this time.

The reporting of this story is so convoluted, it's difficult to tell the sequence of events. News media reported that Shannon Smith approached people making sewer line repairs in his neighborhood. He shot two, killing one, and fled to his home, where he was shot and killed during a short standoff.

Hunter reportedly had an active warrant out for his arrest. A Greenville County Deputy attempted to serve the arrest warrant, and Hunter reportedly presented a gun. A deputy shot and killed Hunter.

Deputies responded to reports of a van driving erratically and attempted a traffic stop. Deputies claim the man inside the car produced an object that looked like a handgun, and at least one deputy shot and killed him. After the shooting, deputies saw the object was not in fact a handgun.

According to police, Jackson was armed with a rifle and allegedly was seen pointing the rifle at an officer. column23: Police initiated a traffic stop on Dolce after he was allegedly speeding. At some point during the stop, Dolce began driving his car, dragging Officer Joe Burson down the road. Burson fired shots at Dolce, killing him. Burson also later died.

During a foot chase, officers tasered the man but continued to struggle before restraining him, police said. Once they got him inside a police cruiser, he told officers that he'd swallowed drugs. The man was transported to a hospital by ambulance and died while en route.

Police claim Jamison shot at officers from inside the store, and officers returned fire, killing Jamison. Jamison had posted on Facebook earlier in the day, and was reportedly feeling suicidal.

column23: Around 3:10 am, a trooper saw a silver Chevrolet SUV travelling at speeds up to 111 miles per hour on Interstate 10 and initiated a traffic stop. During the traffic stop, the driver fled, and the trooper pursued with lights and siren. The Willcox Police Department deployed tire deflation devices near milepost 344 in an attempt to slow the fleeing vehicle. The vehicle ran over the deflation devices, but continued to flee with punctured tires, and fired a handgun at police, striking a police vehicle and shooting the trooper who originally pulled Josiah L. Byard over. Byard then fled on foot. He was found inside a vehicle at a nearby home. He had been in the house and asked the family for a ride into town. When approached, Byard exited the vehicle armed with a handgun and refused commands to surrender. He sought access to the front door of the occupied home with a Glock 31 semi-automatic handgun. Upon entering the residence, two DPS troopers shot and killed him.

Officers were called at about 5:12 a.m. to a report of a stabbing in the parking lot of a QuikTrip. Police said a man stabbed a woman and then fled to a creek area. Officers administered first aid to the woman, who was killed. Her identity has been withheld by police. The officers found the man, who reportedly still had a knife, in a nearby creek and told him to drop the weapon. Police said the man did not comply and attempted to harm himself with the knife. The officers used multiple bean bag rounds on the man who at one point turned toward the officer while holding the knife, police said. The officers shot and killed him.

column23: Gas was reportedly wanted in connection with a deadly shooting that happened on June 8th. Officers engaged in a vehicle pursuit with Gas after a failed traffic stop. Police claim they exchanged shots with Gas, shooting and killing him.

Police allege Flowers was wanted for attempted murder and other charges, claiming he had been involved in 4 shootings within 24 hours. Police claim Flowers ran from them, then turned and fired a gun at officers. Officers shot Flowers four to five times, killing him.

Police responded to a domestic 911 call at an apartment complex. Andrew Homen fled into nearby woods. Police searched the woods for 45 minutes before a police dog found Homen. Homen killed the dog and wounded an officer before being shot and killed.

column23: William Brookins Sr. apparently was holding two people he suspected of shoplifting at gunpoint when a reportedly off-duty officer in full uniform who had been directing traffic reportedly told him to drop the gun and then shot and killed him.
Smith was wanted on a weapons violation and police claim he fired a gun before two deputies shot him. Smith was inside a parked vehicle at the time.
Three male patrons were shot inside the CLE nightclub. One was killed. A Harris County Sheriff's deputy shot and killed the alleged shooter.

Two officers responded to a call around 9:45 p.m. While police were investigating the initial report, they were confronted by the person they were reportedly looking for, who allegedly pointed a gun at them, and police shot and killed Demetrius Stanley

Deputies attempting to pull over a motorcyclist in Yucca Valley engaged in a high-speed chase and shootout, with one deputy, Dominic Vaca, 43, fatally shot, and the motorcyclist killed by deputies in the gunfight.

Wright allegedly entered a liquor store with a rifle slung over his arm and left without paying. Officers later caught up to Hall and the woman and claim Hall raised a long gun at an officer. The officer then shot and killed Hall.

Police responded to reports of a man pointing a rifle at people while attempting to force his way into apartments. Police claim the man began to shoot the rifle in the parking lot of the apartment complex, and police shot and killed him.
Officers responded to reports of a domestic dispute. Upon arrival, they allegedly encountered Lafayette armed with a gun and exchanged gunfire. Lafayette was shot and killed.

Police received a report of a possible kidnapping involving a woman and a man. Witnesses reportedly told police the victim was taken at gunpoint. Warrants on charges of reckless endangerment and first-degree kidnapping were signed against the man. Officers received a tip that the man was at the Microtel Inn and Suites, and the man fired on officers, and the officers shot and killed him. Gary Moncrief's estate said the he was unarmed and getting into a car carrying his mother, aunt and a family friend when he was killed.

At some point, multiple officers fired weapons, killing the individual.

Upon arrival, police located two deputies who were wounded while attempting to serve the warrant. Clarke allegedly shot the deputies and then barricaded himself inside the home. The deputies did exchange gunfire. Officers entered the home, and Clarke was found dead.

Officers responded to reports of a family disturbance, in which a man was allegedly attempting to stab a woman with a knife. Officers allegedly attempted to de-escalate the situation. Police allege the individual raised a knife in an attempt to stab the woman, and two officers shot and killed him.

Officers were dispatched around 6:30 p.m. to an apartment complex on a report of an armed suicidal person. Monolito Ford had reportedly fired at least one shot into the air before police arrived. Three officers responded. The officers encountered Ford, who was armed and began walking toward the officers. After officers ordered him to stop, he reportedly pointed his gun at officers, who shot and killed him.

Officer Jimmy Inn responded to a domestic disturbance call from Lowe's residence. Police allege Lowe answered the door and shot Officer Inn, and then allegedly exchanged gunfire with another officer before re-entering the home. Lowe then allegedly emerged with his child, before a bystander tackled Lowe. Lowe was then shot and killed by police.

Traughber shot his ex-girlfriend Shequita Jones and called the police, requesting a SWAT team. Police arrived and asked Traughber to put his gun down. Jones heard Traughber state he was surrendering, before police shot and killed him.

Brown allegedly shot and killed two neighbors, and injured another. Police responded to the scene and found Brown in a parking lot. Police allegedly commanded Brown to drop his gun and Brown refused. At least four officers shot at Brown, killing him.

Officers were dispatched to a domestic violence situation and 911 hang-up. 911 dispatchers heard sounds of struggle and screaming during the phone call. Two officers shot at Pinke multiple times, killing him.
Police were searching for an alleged kidnapper and double-murder suspect, Eric Smith. Smith was killed he exchanged gunfire with officers. Police also shot and killed the baby La'Mello Parker.

Casey was doing laundry and began having a mental health crisis. Casey allegedly had a gun and began shooting in the air. Police responded and allege Casey refused to put down the gun. Officers hsot and killed him.
Officers were serving a search warrant and Brown attempted to drive away. Deputies fired at him multiple times while he was driving, killing him.
Police responded to reports of a fight outside of a home. Officer Nicholas Reardon fired his weapon several times, killing Bryant.

Baker allegedly drove away from the stop and stopped a short distance later. Officer then claim Baker exited the vehicle with a gun. An officer used a taser on Baker, and police allege Baker shot the officer in the leg. The officer and a backup officer then shot and killed Baker.

Police were called to a suspected carjacking. Upon arrival, they spoke to witnesses and identified an alleged suspect. The suspect allegedly ran away, and police chased after them. Police allege the person was armed and ignored several warnings to drop the weapon. Police claim the person aimed a gun at an officer, who shot and killed the person.

Police responded to a call regarding an armed disturbance. The caller alleges Jenkins made unwanted sexual advances towards her child. The caller claims Jenkins attempted to shoot himself in the head but the gun did not go off. Jenkins then allegedly shot at the ground, prompting the caller to call 911 and leave the scene. When police arrived, they allege Jenkins ahd a gun in his pocket. Jenkins allegedly walked towards officers and one deployed their taser on Jenkins. Police allege Jenkins attempted to grab a gun and deployed the taser again. After being tased a second time, police allege Jenkins pulled out his gun and one sergeant fired at least seven times within seconds. Jenkins later died.

Officers responded to report of a domestic dispute involving a man who authorities say shot into a vehicle carrying his two children, ages 3 and 5, and their mother. As officers were speaking with the victim, police said they observed Roderick Inge driving in the area and chased him. After a short car chase, Inge ditched his vehicle in a parking lot and ran into a wooded area. He was found in a wooded area, and allegedly produced and fired a handgun as officers approached. The officers shot and killed him.

Officers initially responded to the scene after receiving a call from citizens about the suspect, who had a warrant out for his arrest in connection to a homicide that occurred approximately eight blocks away, because he was “terrorizing” the neighborhood. Officers fatally shot the man on Monday, seconds after he opened his front door and began firing two handguns.One of the shots struck Officer Brandon Stalker, who was crouched behind a police vehicle. Stalker, a 24-year-old who became an officer in 2018, died Monday at a hospital.Lee was wanted for two crimes, including the murder of a Shaker Heights mother on Sept. 1.

Officers responded to a call reporting a man was sitting in a car outside of a woman's house. When officers confronted Myeni, he allegedly charged at the officers. One officer deployed his taser at Myeni, and other officers shot at Myeni, killing him.
Thompson was shot and killed by police in a school bathroom. Police have withheld nearly all details about the shooting, and have walked back on the claim that Thompson shot an officer.

Officers called to Mount Carmel St. Ann's Hospital, where the person was being treated after passing out. A Georgia State Trooper pulled a vehicle over for speeding. The vehicle stopped initially, but as the trooper approached the car, it allegedly drove off. A pursuit began and troopers allege a passenger shot at patrol cars with a rifle. The vehicle eventually crashed and the two individuals ran out of the car. Police allege the individuals shot at officers throughout the pursuit. One suspect was shot and killed by officers, and the other was taken into custody.

Potter approached Wright while he was standing outside of his car and another officer is arresting him. Potter shouted at Wright and shot and killed him.

Police responded to reports of an armed man attempting to break into cars at a gas station. When officers arrived, the man fled to a nearby McDonald's. Police allege Tanner attempted to take a car from others, pointing a gun at them and later police. Officers shot and killed him.

Around 6:45 p.m., two officers pulled over a vehicle and ran the names of the four occupants inside. Two came back wanted for outstanding warrants. Police called for backup. A passenger allegedly started firing at officers from inside the vehicle. The man then exited the vehicle and fired another round at police, who shot and killed James Alexander.

About 5 a.m. in the parking lot of a condominium complex, officers responded to a call of shots fired and were approached by an off-duty Pentagon Force Protection Agency police officer who said he thought a car was being burglarized. He engaged the men who failed to follow his direction. Dominique Williams, 32, and James Lionel Johnson, 38, attempted to flee in a vehicle from the man with a gun, at which time David Hall Dixon shot and killed the men. Dixon was charged with second-degree murder.

About 5 a.m. in the parking lot of a condominium complex, officers responded to a call of shots fired and were approached by an off-duty Pentagon Force Protection Agency police officer who said he thought a car was being burglarized. He engaged the men who failed to follow his direction. Dominique Williams, 32, and James Lionel Johnson, 38, attempted to flee in a vehicle from the man with a gun, at which time David Hall Dixon shot and killed the men. Dixon was charged with second-degree murder.

At approximately 10:50 p.m., Birmingham police received a call stating that two people were involved in a domestic disturbance inside a vehicle in North Birmingham. North Precinct officers found the vehicle in the 300 block of 9th Avenue West and pursued it until the driver hit a fence in the 200 block of 9th Avenue West stopping the vehicle. Desmon Montez Ray allegedly got out and confronted officers with a firearm. Police shot and killed Ray.
The Centreville Police Department officers killed Diwone Wallace. Details as to what precipitated the killing were withheld by police.

Noah Green allegedly rammed into two officers and a barricade outside the Capitol, killing U.S. Capitol Police officer William "Billy" Evans. The second officer who was hit has been hospitalized but is in stable and non-threatening condition. Green was shot and killed by police after getting out of the car with a knife in hand and lunging at them.

Around 6:30 p.m., police in Rock Island saw a wanted person, DeShawn Tatum, who was considered armed and dangerous. As officers approached Tatum, he fled. Tatum was followed to a nearby gas station where police allege Tatum hijacked a car from a bystander. As officers tried to remove Tatum from the car, he allegedly began to drive in reverse, dragging several police officers. Police shot and killed Tatum.

Police were trailing a man who they allege had several felony warrants and may have been armed.Two officers approached the man and confronted him.When the man was attacked by a police dog, he allegedly produced a firearm, and police shot and killed him.

Officers spotted a vehicle potentially involved in a shooting. The driver, Willie Roy Allen, took off and crashed moments later. Officers chased Allen when he tried to run and attempted to stun him with a Taser. Allen allegedly pulled out a gun and multiple officers shot, tasered and killed him.

There was a domestic disturbance at the Quality Inn, starting around 6:30 a.m. A woman called officers there several more times, the last time shortly after 12:30 p.m. The man, Michael Leon Hughes, had forced his way back into the room after he had left earlier. When two officers arrived, Hughes refused to leave. The officers tried to take Hughes into custody, and there was a more than 60-second fight with one of the officers. Hughes reportedly got control of Officer J. H. Wing's Taser and stunned him once and then the officer shot and killed him.

column13: Lynch loved basketball, football, playing pool and fashion. He was a volunteer and member of Faith World Ministries.

There were initially two officers and the man, Malcolm D. Johnson, in the store. Later, two other offers entered. Johnson retrieved a gun and struck one of the officers. During that shooting, officers shot and killed him.

When Chadwell fled, officers pursued, and one officer was shot. Following that shooting, other officers continued to chase Chadwell. During a shootout with police, police shot and killed Chadwell.

Aaron Pierre Thomas was wanted for an armed robbery in Danville, Virginia, when U.S. marshals and other police surrounded a house where he was staying. When officers arrived, Thomas came outside firing. One of the U.S. marshals was injured. Police shot and killed Thomas, who died about six months later.

Officers pulled over a man and told him to get out of the vehicle. An officer reportedly got hurt in a fight. When backup officers arrived, they found the man exhibiting aggressive behavior. Officers sicced a dog on him, and after he was restrained he reportedly started having a medical emergency. Multiple doses of Narcan were not successful, and he died.

A man tried to steal a bicycle from a bus and got into a confrontation with the bike owner that led to the suspect pulling out a gun and shooting. He took the bike and ended up at a Chevron gas station, where he then started shooting at the gas station when an employee wouldn't let him inside. While at the gas station, he stole a vehicle from a patron who was pumping gas and left, eventually crashing the vehicle into a market. When officers responded there was a confrontation and exchange of gunfire, and police shot and killed the man.

Exzabian Morgan Myers was reportedly under the influence of drugs when he became belligerent during an arrest. He was tasered and place in hand and leg restraints and administered Narcan, dying a short time later.

Deputies responded to a call about a man armed with a knife and acting erratically. He had blood on his clothing, but it was not clear where it came from. The first officer struggled with the man, and at some point, a Taser reportedly was used. When two additional officers arrived, both shot at and killed the man.

Police began searching the area and eventually found Ruffin. Police shot Ruffin after he allegedly failed to respond to officers' orders.

That individual was not in the vehicle, and Baker proceeded to question Holbert. Holbert tells Baker the vehicle is not hers and Baker proceeded to search through Holbert's bag. Baker alleges he found drugs in Holbert's purse and walked back to his patrol vehicle. Holbert gets her purse again and gets back into the vehicle. Baker escalates and uses his taser on Holbert and tugs on her to exit the vehicle. He then shoots Holbert, killing her.

column23: Police received calls from more than one motorist that a man was throwing rocks off the overpass of Sycamore Valley Road onto Interstate 680. Wilson advanced toward the officer, who shot and killed him.

A man grabbed a knife from Open Door Mission, left the building and was threatening to harm himself. He began cutting himself and allegedly threatening officers. Officers retreated and the man allegedly ran towards them. One officer fired at the man, killing him.

Police responded to reports of a domestic argument. Upon arrival, they saw Gale in the parking lot pointing a gun at his ex-girlfriend. They had recently broken up and Gale had allegedly broken into her apartment. Gale shot his ex-girlfriend, and Officer Brent Behrens immediately shot Gale.

Police began pursuing Teague who was wanted on a felony assault warrant. Frankling County deputies caught up to Teague's vehicle, and he proceeded to drive the wrong way on the interstate, striking two oncoming vehicles. Teague got out of his vehicle and was confronted by officers who shot Teague.

After the Cincinnati shootings, Moore drove to Detroit and stayed at Rivertown Inn & Suites. The Detroit Police Department learned of his location and waited until Moore exited the building to take action. Moore left the motel building about 9:50 a.m. and walked toward his car. Moore saw the police and shot at the officers, who shot and killed him.
Deputies responded to an apartment complex to reports of shots fired. Upon arrival, deputies encountered an armed man who allegedly began firing at them. Deputies returned fire, striking the man.
Officers were alerted to a shooting, and chased the suspect, Tyson, into a parking garage. Police allege Tyson tried to fire a gun at them and officers returned fire, hitting Tyson.
A deputy responded to a welfare check at Hairston's house. Police allege he fired a gun at deputies before he was fatally shot.

A person came into the police station stating they were a victim of domestic violence and had been assaulted with a firearm. The victim identified Alonte Murphy as the alleged assailant. Around 5 p.m., police saw Murphy pull up in a car. Murphy was allegedly armed with a semiautomatic handgun and exchanged gunfire with officers. Police shot and killed Murphy.

Arnell States allegedly stabbed two women and was shot and killed by Officer Kyzer Moore while fleeing the area where the stabbings occurred.

Officers were sent to a woman's home after getting a report of a burglary in progress. They arrived to find a man inside the home, and they tried to arrest him. He ran from them, and they chased him through several neighborhoods. Officers found him hiding in an outbuilding and shot and killed him. Details as to what precipitated the killing were withheld by police.
Officers were responding to a call about a suspicious person around 11:30 p.m. Police alleged De'Aire Gray ran from the officer and displayed a weapon, and the officer shot and killed him.

column23: Police responded to a domestic incident just after 10 a.m., where a woman reported her ex-boyfriend possibly had a gun.
